intro: Glandularia jordanensis, commonly known as Jordan's glandular germander, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant features glandular hairs on its leaves and stems, which contribute to its distinctive appearance and may play a role in its ecological interactions. It typically thrives in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Glandularia jordanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
